meanings.definition: Arranged or having parts arranged like rays.
meanings.sent1: The sunflower had radial petals that spread out like rays.
meanings.sent2: The star-shaped snowflake had radial symmetry.
meanings.sent3: The radial design on the carpet made it look like a giant sunburst.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness radiated outwards in a radial pattern, touching everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks exploded in a radial display of colors, lighting up the night sky.

meanings.definition: Relating to or situated near the radius of the forearm.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the radial pulse in the patient's wrist.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sharp pain in her radial artery after the fall.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power came from his radial bracelet that enhanced his strength.
meanings.sent4: Her love for painting was evident in the radial brush strokes she used.
meanings.sent5: The henna tattoo artist created a beautiful radial design on her forearm.

meanings.definition: A tire in which the cords run at right angles to the circumference.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic recommended replacing the worn-out radial on the car.
meanings.sent2: He preferred using radials for better traction on wet roads.
meanings.sent3: The cyclist's punctured radial needed to be patched up before the race.
meanings.sent4: The new radials improved the car's handling and performance.
meanings.sent5: The tire shop offered a discount on radials for the holiday season.
